replies.body: It's technically considered a "Homophobic Slur" but Riot obviously doesn't know half the internet uses it as a joke..

Used as a joke or not, saying it's ok encourages the actual homophobes, and for those who don't care it reinforces the negative culture. It might sound dumb but it's valid psychology that has real effects.

So yes, it's a homophobic slur that they're enforcing. Besides, this guy, totally not using it as a 'joke'. The rest of his chat isn't great either.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=z2pXsQ3y,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-05-14T11:59:18.440+0000)

> 
> So yes, it's a homophobic slur that they're enforcing. Besides, this guy, totally not using it as a 'joke'. The rest of his chat isn't great either.

The real question is why straight people get upset when they're called a %%%got? I mean, gay people shouldn't be offended because they are technically a %%%got, but still.

Funny it's almost like people don't like being directly insulted, especially when the insulter doesn't even have the decency to insult them for *who* they are but instead is insulting them for *what* they are. It's almost like that toxic ass doesn't see them (straight or gay) as a real person and is reducing them to a derogatory word, regardless of what their actual circumstances are.

I know there's no point telling you this, since you're a resident troll here, but it's really not hard to be a jackass. You should try it sometime.

You know what's funny? How sensitive and uptight this generation is, it's a bunch of stupid words on the internet. Grow up, if you can't handle dark humor then get off the internet. This isn't real life, if you're getting triggered by as much as a single word then close your fucking laptop screen, turn off your computer, put down your phone, and go outside for once. You obviously don't belong here.

You would be held accountable for those words in person. Just because your on the internet does not magically make it so you can't be hold responsible for your words and actions. 

Also the majority of today's society is run through computers/phones/the internet so saying stay away from them isn't a soloution.

Personally, I'm a fan of dark humour, I'll laugh at dead baby jokes and the like (assuming they are actually jokes). In saying that however, I also acknowledge that I am not everyone else, and that such humour can hit pain points for certain people. If you knew someone who was beaten to death for being gay, you wouldn't exactly be welcoming of the idea that people are throwing around baseless and meaningless hate for the fun of it.

I also acknowledge that it is termed dark humour for a reason, and that just as some people find Jazz offensive to the ears, some people are going to find dark humour more than distasteful. That is why we create smaller communities within bigger ones, to bring people of similar tastes together without forcing those tastes on others.

It's all well and good to say 'banter' if it's within a friend group, but if you are telling strangers on the internet to go kill themselves you need to seriously reconsider your life.

Do I think some people need to be less offended by things? Yes, absolutely, you aren't going to get by in life if you let every little thing destroy your composure. Do I think, "it's just words" is a valid excuse for enabling abusive behaviour? Absolutely fucking not. It's really not hard to not be an asshole. If some idiot points a gun at someone and fires but misses them the response isn't, oh you didn't get hurt there's no problem here.

Noone is perfect, I've called people dickhead or buttmuncher or complete fucking disgrace of a human being in the past (in my defense, this was irl and he totally deserved it) but why does it have to be [insert homophobic slur] or [insert racist slur] when that has absolutely nothing to do with who they are as a person? Whether you mean it in that way or not, it perpetuates the idea that it's ok.

If someone is an asshole it's because they're an asshole not because they are black, or gay, or chinese, or female.
